bugSigSimple 0.99.0

    • UNKNOWN TITLE

    capstoneanalysis_fatima.rmd

    Setup phase

    Install and load relevant packages

    install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("waldronlab/bugSigSimple")
devtools::install_github("waldronlab/bugSigDB")

    Load bugSigSimple and bugSigDB

    #library(bugSigDB)
library (bugSigSimple)

    dat <- readCurationSheet(“/Users/ftzohra22/Desktop/School/Spring 2019/capstone/capstone analysis/Microbial signatures curation - signatures.tsv”) dim(dat)

    #subsetting all signatures by curator my.dat <- subsetByCurator(dat, curator=“Fatima Zohra”) # all conditions curated by curator table(my.dat[,“condition”]) my.dat[,“condition”] <- sub(" $“,”", my.dat[,“condition”])

    #restricting data to certain conditions for analysis ind <- my.dat[,“condition”] %in% c(“chronic obstructive pulmonary disease”,“autism”,“drug dependence”, “schizophrenia”, “anorexia nervosa”, “anxiety disorder”, “post-traumic stress disorder”, “attention deficit hyperactivity disorder”, “psychosis”, “gestational diabetes”,“alzheimer’s disease”,“parkinson’s disease”,“stimulus or stress design”) my.dat2 <- my.dat[!ind,] dim(my.dat2) table(my.dat2[,“condition”])

    #removing one study from analysis my.pubmed.ids <- c(“28035686”,“28620208”) ind <- my.dat2[,“PMID”] %in% my.pubmed.ids my.dat3 <- my.dat2[!ind, ]

    list of conditions included in analysis

    table(my.dat3[,“condition”])

    #overall frequencies of taxa in up and down getMostFrequentTaxa(my.dat3, n=30) getMostFrequentTaxa(my.dat3,sig.type= “UP”) getMostFrequentTaxa(my.dat3,sig.type= “DOWN”)

    #binomial test in UP binom.test(x=4, n=6) binom.test(x=4, n=4) binom.test(x=4, n=4) binom.test(x=4, n=5) binom.test(x=4, n=5) binom.test(x=3, n=4) binom.test(x=3, n=5) binom.test(x=3, n=3) binom.test(x=3, n=3) binom.test(x=3, n=4)

    #binomial test in Down binom.test(x=7, n=8) binom.test(x=6, n=6) binom.test(x=4, n=5) binom.test(x=4, n=5) binom.test(x=3, n=5) binom.test(x=3, n=5) binom.test(x=2, n=6) binom.test(x=2, n=2) binom.test(x=2, n=3) binom.test(x=2, n=2)

    #adjusting p value by Bonferroni correction pvals <- c(0.6875, 0.125, 0.375, 0.625, 1, 0.25, 0.07031, 0.03125, 0.6875, 0.5) adj.pvals <- p.adjust(pvals, method=“bonferroni”) adj.pvals

    #subsutting only on MDD ind <- my.dat3[,“condition”] %in% c(“bipolar disorder”) my.dat.mdd <- my.dat3[!ind,] dim(my.dat.mdd) table(my.dat.mdd[,“condition”])

    getMostFrequentTaxa(my.dat.mdd, n=20) getMostFrequentTaxa(my.dat.mdd,sig.type= “UP”) getMostFrequentTaxa(my.dat.mdd,sig.type= “DOWN”)

    #binomial test in UP binom.test(x=3, n=3) binom.test(x=3, n=3) binom.test(x=3, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=3) binom.test(x=2, n=2) binom.test(x=2, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=3) binom.test(x=2, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=2)

    #binomial test in Down binom.test(x=4, n=5) binom.test(x=4, n=4) binom.test(x=4, n=5) binom.test(x=3, n=5) binom.test(x=2, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=2) binom.test(x=2, n=2)

    #adjusting p value by FDR correction pvals <- c(0.6875, 0.125, 0.375, 0.625, 1, 0.25, 0.07031, 0.03125, 0.6875, 0.5) adj.pvals <- p.adjust(pvals, method=“fdr”) adj.pvals

    #subsutting only on MDD ind <- my.dat3[,“condition”] %in% c(“unipolar depression”) my.dat.bd <- my.dat3[!ind,] dim(my.dat.bd) table(my.dat.bd[,“condition”])

    getMostFrequentTaxa(my.dat.bd, n=20) getMostFrequentTaxa(my.dat.bd,sig.type= “UP”) getMostFrequentTaxa(my.dat.bd,sig.type= “DOWN”)

    #binomial test in UP binom.test(x=4, n=4) binom.test(x=4, n=4) binom.test(x=4, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=2) binom.test(x=2, n=2) binom.test(x=2, n=2) binom.test(x=2, n=3) binom.test(x=1, n=2)

    #binomial test in Down binom.test(x=4, n=5) binom.test(x=4, n=4) binom.test(x=4, n=5) binom.test(x=3, n=5) binom.test(x=2, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=4) binom.test(x=2, n=2) binom.test(x=2, n=2)

    #faecalibacterium taxa.mdd <- c(up=1/7, down=4/7) taxa.bd <- c(up=0/4, down=3/4) barplot(rbind(taxa.mdd, taxa.bd), beside=TRUE, col=c(“red”,“blue”), legend=TRUE, args.legend=list(x=“topleft”, legend=c(“major depressive disorder”, “bipolar disorder”)), ylab=“relative frequency”, main=“Frequency of Faecalibacterium”)

    #Actinobacteria taxa.mdd <- c(up=2/7, down=2/7) taxa.bd <- c(up=2/4, down=0/4) barplot(rbind(taxa.mdd, taxa.bd), beside=TRUE, col=c(“red”,“blue”), legend=TRUE, args.legend=list(x=“topright”, cex = 0.70, legend=c(“major depressive disorder”, “bipolar disorder”)), ylab=“relative frequency”, main=“Frequency of Actinobacteria”)

    #Bacteroides

    taxa.mdd <- c(up=2/7, down=2/7) taxa.bd <- c(up=0/4, down=2/4) barplot(rbind(taxa.mdd, taxa.bd), beside=TRUE, col=c(“red”,“blue”), legend=TRUE, args.legend=list(x=“topleft”, cex = 0.80, legend=c(“major depressive disorder”, “bipolar disorder”)), ylab=“relative frequency”, main=“Frequency of Bacteroides”)

    #Ruminococcaceae taxa.mdd <- c(up=0/7, down=4/7) taxa.bd <- c(up=0/4, down=2/4) barplot(rbind(taxa.mdd, taxa.bd), beside=TRUE, col=c(“red”,“blue”), legend=TRUE, args.legend=list(x=“topleft”, cex = 0.75, legend=c(“major depressive disorder”, “bipolar disorder”)), ylab=“relative frequency”, main=“Frequency of Ruminococcaceae”)
